subject: RE: [junit] junit trying to run inexistant .class method!
msgSnippet: ... It s hard to tell without your sources but it looks like you are trying to do a forName on a string that ends in .class... How about putting a trace before
messageBody:
> From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On

> I have absolutely no idea why Junit is trying to run one of
> my tests as if its ".class" field was a test method.
> The test itself has already run as part of its own package
> but it looks like Junit tries to run the class as if it was a
> package and the field as if it was a method... weird!
> An example of which can be seen here:
> http://nagafix.co.uk/products/metastores/doc/tests/

It's hard to tell without your sources but it looks like you are trying to
do a forName on a string that ends in .class...

How about putting a trace before the forName to see all the classes it tries
to instantiate?

--
